lead_paragraph: Customers say they want to keep the right to sue, and the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau has proposed a ban on such moves by banks.

headline.print_headline: In Fine Print of More Checking Accounts, a Binding Arbitration Clause
headline.main: More Big Banks Are Using Arbitration to Bar Customer Lawsuits

snippet: Customers say they want to keep the right to sue, and the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau has proposed a ban on such moves by banks....
abstract: Ann Carrns Your Money Adviser column notes large banks are using fine print of checking account agreements to hamper customers' ability to settle disputes in court; questions answered about binding arbitration clauses.
